中文法規名稱: 特定醫療技術檢查檢驗醫療儀器施行或使用管理辦法

法規內容.條文內容: This Regulation is formulated in accordance with Paragraph 2, Article 62 of the Medical Care Act (hereinafter referred to as “the Act”).

The specific medical technique, examination, or medical device (hereinafter referred to as “specific medical examination item”), its items, applicable indications, qualifications of operator, conditions, and related entities specified in this Regulation are as per the Appendix.

Specific medical examination items of the type of equipment capable of producing ionizing radiation or requiring the use of radioactive materials shall additionally conform to the Ionizing Radiation Protection Act.

Medical institutions applying or using medical examination items shall apply for registration with the municipal/city/county competent authorities in their respective districts prior to operation.
The municipal/city/county competent authority shall deny the applications for registration from medical institutions that do not conform to the requirements specified in Appendix for Article 2.  However, corrections needed for conformity shall be permitted within a completion deadline.

Medical institutions applying for registration to the municipal/city/county competent authority in accordance with the preceding Article shall render the following documents:
1. True copy of certificates demonstrating the qualifications specified in Appendix for Article 2.
2. True copy of the import or manufacturing permits for the medical device used.
3. Other documents required by the central competent authority.

Medical institutions terminating or stopping the application or use of specific medical examination items subsequent to registration of such items, or having changes to the operators of such items shall apply for registration changes to the original municipal/city/county competent authority within thirty (30) days of the occurrence.

Medical institutions applying or using specific medical examination items but failing to conform to the requirements specified in Appendix for Article 2 due to change of circumstances shall immediately stop the application or use, and make corrections within two months.
Violators of the stipulation in the preceding paragraph shall be penalized pursuant to Articles 103 and 107 of the Act, and their registration for the items shall be revoked by the municipal/city/county competent authority.

Medical institutions applying or using specific medical examination items for indications other than those specified in Appendix for Article 2 shall be penalized pursuant to Articles 103 and 107 of the Act, and their registration for the items shall be revoked by the municipal/city/county competent authority, except:
1. During an emergency.
2. Those institutions performing human trail with prior approval from the central competent authority.
3. For indications already approved overseas, in which case improvements shall first be made.

Medical institution of which registration has been revoked pursuant to the preceding two Articles shall not re-apply for registration of the same items within two months of the revocation; operators shall not register, apply, or use the specific medical examination items within six months of the revocation.

Medical institutes have used the specific medical examination items prior to the amendment to Appendix for Article 2 of this Regulation shall apply for registration pursuant to this Regulation within six months of the effective date of the amendment to Appendix for Article 2 of this Regulation.
This Regulation is effective on the date of promulgation.
